item.title: Court Ruling Hands Victory to Uber, Lyft
item.description: A California appeals court decision preserves the companies’ independent-contract model in the state and could bolster their efforts elsewhere.

item.title: 'Every Parent's Nightmare': TikTok Is a Venue for Child Sexual Exploitation
item.description: Law-enforcement officials say the social-media platform has emerged as the biggest danger zone. Its algorithm works so that adults who watch videos of young people are served up more of them.

item.title: Microsoft Adds ChatGPT AI Technology to Bing Search Engine
item.description: The breakout success of OpenAI has put Microsoft at the forefront of what some see as the next wave of technological innovation.

item.title: China's Baidu Developing Its Own ChatGPT, Joining Global AI Race
item.description: Baidu plans to integrate the AI-powered chatbot it is developing into its main search engine in March, people familiar with the matter said.

item.title: Google Follows Microsoft in Unveiling AI Search Features
item.description: The Alphabet unit described new types of search results days after it opened Bard, an artificial-intelligence service, to testing.

item.title: Google Opens Testing of Its ChatGPT Rival
item.description: Google is rolling out a conversational artificial-intelligence service, called Bard, to a select set of testers, and plans a broader public launch in coming weeks, as it plays catch-up with challengers.

item.title: Wood-Fired Hot Tubs: A Blissful (If Demanding) Route to Relaxation
item.description: Firing up a premium tub from companies like Goodland and Snorkel requires some elbow grease, but that effort is rewarded, say fans who soak in the fragrant, rejuvenating experience—and the open air

item.title: Microsoft's Activision Deal Handed Setback by U.K. Regulator
item.description: A potential deal would harm gamers, the U.K.’s Competition and Markets Authority said, and remedies could include divesting of Activision’s publishing and Blizzard Entertainment units.

item.title: I Thought I Was a Terrible Runner. This Free App Changed My Mind.
item.description: The Nike Run Club app hasn’t just improved my running—it’s also made it fun

item.title: Guns Offered for Sale in Facebook Groups Devoted to Religious Extremists in India
item.description: Facebook rejected complaints about the posts violating the company’s rules, then later took the posts down.

item.title: A Senator's Twitter Account Was Suspended Over a Hunting Photo. Then Elon Musk Stepped In.
item.description: Steve Daines, a Montana Republican, said his account was blocked over a picture flagged for “graphic violence.”

item.title: Meta Pursues Teen Users as Horizon Metaverse App Struggles to Grow
item.description: The Facebook parent’s updated strategy for the fledgling app includes opening it up to teens aged 13 to 17.

item.title: I Tried Microsoft's New AI-Powered Bing. Search Will Never Be the Same.
item.description: Our columnist got an early look at the software giant’s addition of ChatGPT powers to its search engine.

item.title: Dell to Cut 5% of Workforce
item.description: The computer maker said it is reorganizing certain teams as market conditions continue to erode.

item.title: Judge Releases Decision Approving Meta's Virtual-Reality Deal
item.description: The unsealed ruling lays out the FTC’s loss of its bid to block the Facebook parent company’s acquisition.

item.title: How to Reduce Your Email Mess and Stress
item.description: Heed these productivity-boosting tech tips for Gmail and Outlook users.

item.title: Don't Be the Parent Who Ghostwrites the Kids' Texts
item.description: Composing texts for your teens doesn’t teach them communication skills. Convey this advice from etiquette experts instead.

item.title: AI Tech Enables Industrial-Scale Intellectual-Property Theft, Say Critics
item.description: Are ChatGPT, Stability AI and GitHub Copilot the next big breakthroughs, huge legal and regulatory liabilities, or something else entirely?

item.title: Musk Found Not Liable in Trial Over Tweets Proposing to Take Tesla Private
item.description: A jury rejected investor claims that Elon Musk violated federal securities law when he tweeted in 2018 about potentially taking Tesla private.

item.title: Jurors in Elon Musk Trial Over Tesla Tweets Begin Deliberating
item.description: Investors allege the CEO’s tweets about taking the electric-car maker private violated federal securities law.
